intro: Pseudoxandra papillosa, commonly known as the silky pseudoxandra, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and trees. The plant is characterized by its soft, hairy leaves that give it a distinctive silvery appearance. It produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow. Pseudoxandra papillosa is often found in humid, shaded environments such as forest understories.
